Description.En:
Energy has become an increasingly important factor in recent years. We have transitioned from a world where energy was cheap and readily available to one where it is becoming more difficult to obtain. Furthermore, **energy consumption has dramatic consequences for the environment,** as its use leads to an increase in CO2 concentration and subsequently, **global warming**. Understanding this factor and being able to manage it quantitatively is becoming increasingly necessary for the next generation.

In this course, we will be studying**transportation and analyzing it in terms of energy**. We will learn how to **calculate the impact of our transportation systems**in terms of energy, and explore the best strategies to reduce their impact.

NoteLiteral.En: Analyze and evaluate the energy requirements of different transportation modes, assessing their environmental impact in terms of greenhouse gas emissions and air pollution.

Title.En: State of the art of sustainable modes of transportation.

NoteLiteral.En: Stay updated on research advancements and initiatives aimed at mitigating the environmental impact of transportation, evaluate the level of implementation of these initiatives, and make informed decisions about more sustainable transportation practices to minimize the global impact on the planet.

Title.En: Understand the current dependence on fossil fuels in various modes of transportation.

NoteLiteral.En: Be able to make a comparative analysis of fossil fuel consumption with other alternative energy sources for each mode.

Title.En: Make informed decisions that promote sustainable practices.

NoteLiteral.En: Identify technologies capable of carrying the necessary energy and power for transportation, such as electricity, hydrogen, and biofuels, while considering their limitations in terms of land use and material accessibility. Use this knowledge to make informed decisions that promote sustainable practices.

Title.En: Attain proficiency in sustainable energy sources for optimal transportation power solutions.

NoteLiteral.En: Acquire knowledge about available sustainable energy sources to meet the specific energy and power requirements of the most commonly used transportation systems.

MoreInformation.NoteLiteral:
The course consists in **8 digital recordings**, in English, created by UAB professor Xavier Alvarez, expert in the field of Energy.

At the end of each module, a test will give the learner the opportunity to assess his/her learning outcome, and at the end of the course, the learner will prepare a **final project** about what was teached during the course. The teacher will evaluate this final essay.

Since this is an open online course, you have the flexibility to progress through the material at your own pace.

**1 online session with the teamcher** will be held **on February 28, 2025, at 11:00 AM,** at the beggining of the course to present and review the content of the micro-module and to address any doubts you might have. Assistance to this session is not mandatory but it is highly encouraged.

In this course, we will be studying transportation and analyzing it in terms of energy. We will learn how to calculate the impact of our transportation systems in terms of energy, and explore the best strategies to reduce their impact.

Applicants will be notified of their admission results within five days following the application deadline

**Entry requirements**:

- being affiliated with one of the 13 ECIU university members
- B2 level of English language proficiency.

**Documents to be submitted**:

- Curriculum Vitae (CV)
- Document with the following information and a copy (or picture) of your passport/ID card
    - Name
    - Last Name
    - Nationality
    - Date of birth
    - City of birth
    - Current address
    - Email
    - Telephone

If you have any other questions please contact us at **eciu.admissions@uab.cat**
